radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal, confluent periventricular signal hyperintensity and scattered focal subcortical signal hyperintensity in both cerebral hemispheres, with mild ventricular prominence.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Retrospectively, MRI of the head performed at the time of the first admission showed subtle signal hyperintensity in the striatum and thalami on T2-weighted FLAIR images as well as on diffusion-weighted images. During the second admission, imaging showed mild signal hyperintensity in the bilateral basal ganglia and thalami, especially in the caudate nuclei.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Combined positron-emission tomography and computed tomography (PET-CT)
